name: The Film History of Robin Williams II Trivia Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: After a very busy 1991, Robin Williams took it rather easy in 1992.  He *only* appeared in two live-action movies (not to mention providing his voice for three animated flicks).  In which independent film, directed by Bobcat Goldthwait, does Robin submit an hilarious performance as a mime drill instructor?
questions.explanation:
Shakes the Clown.

	In 'Shakes the Clown', Robin Williams is given credit with one of his several pseudonyms, namely 'Marty Fromage' ('fromage' being the word for 'cheese' in French). 'Shakes the Clown' is the story of an alcoholic clown for hire who is having difficulty coping with life.  Things get even worse for Shakes when he is accused of murdering his boss.

questions.text: Mr. Robin Williams doesn't just have to do it with his face and body, he can also use just his voice to make us laugh.  In which animated Disney 1990s classic does Robin Williams provide an outrageously boisterous performance?
questions.explanation:
Aladdin.

	Robin Williams plays 'Genie' in this classic tale of a street kid who falls in love with a princess, and uses a magic lamp that he finds in order to gain her affections. Robin Williams does dozens of impressions in this movie, including ones of Arnold Schwarzenegger, Ed Sullivan, Groucho Marx and Carol Channing.

questions.text: One of Robin Williams's most memorable performances of the 1990s is as Mrs. Doubtfire in the movie of that title.  What is the name of Robin's male alter-ego in this hilarious comedy?
questions.explanation:
Daniel Hillard.

	Mrs. Doubtfire's full name is Mrs. Euphegenia Doubtfire.  Robin Williams based Mrs. Doubtfire's Scottish accent on that of Bill Forsyth, the two having worked together on 'Being Human'.   In the movie, Daniel Hillard is a father who loses his rights to visit his children.  In order to get closer to them, he dons the garb of an elderly Scottish woman and comes to work as their nanny.

questions.text: In which Hugh Grant vehicle does Robin Williams make a truly memorable appearance as the frenetic/madcap Dr. Kosevich?
questions.explanation:
Nine Months.

	Although I am not a fan of Hugh Grant, and certainly not a fan of 'Nine Months', I will tune into this film if it's on television just to see the Robin Williams' parts.  Robin is especially funny when he, as a doctor, passes out at the sight of an epidural syringe. 'Nine Months' is the story of a man who learns that his girlfriend has become pregnant.  Together they must come to grips with the fact that they are expectant parents.

questions.text: Which of Robin William's 1990s movies is based on a children's book by Chris Van Allsburg?
questions.explanation:
Jumanji.

	'Jumanji' is the story of two children who discover a board game that literally takes them into the action.  Robin Williams plays Alan Parish, a man who has been trapped inside the game for 26 years and must now play himself out.

questions.text: 'The Birdcage' is an absolute joy to watch.  In it, Robin Williams plays the 'husband' in a gay couple.  What is his surname in this wonderful comedy?
questions.explanation:
Goldman.

	Robin Williams generously allows Nathan Lane to steal the show in this film.  Robin was originally cast as Albert, the more flamboyant half of the loving lead couple, but decided that he wanted to play the more reserved Armand Goldman.  Lane is perfect as Albert, and Williams provides good supporting acting here.

questions.text: Robin Williams received his first Oscar nomination for the film 'Good Will Hunting'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Robin had been nominated three times prior to his win for 1997's 'Good Will Hunting'.  Specifically, he was nominated for the 1987 film 'Good Morning, Vietnam', for 1989's 'Dead Poets Society' and for his role in the 1991 film 'The Fisher King'.  All prior nominations were for Best Actor, whereas his Oscar for 'Good Will Hunting' was a Supporting nod.

questions.text: In 'Patch Adams', the Robin Williams character uses humor to treat his patients.  What is the first name of this character, who goes by the nickname 'Patch'?
questions.explanation:
Hunter.

	Hunter 'Patch' Adams is a real life person, and once served as a medical advisor for the television series 'M*A*S*H'.  He is an acquaintance of Mike Farrell (BJ Hunnicut), one of the producers of this film.  The movie is based on a book by Adams entitled 'Gesundheit: Good Health Is a Laughing Matter'.

questions.text: In 2002, Robin Williams' career took a dark turn when he decided to appear in several thrillers.  In one film, he portrays a lonely man named Sy Parrish who becomes obsessed with a family, and begins spying on them.  What is this film entitled?
questions.explanation:
One Hour Photo.

	Also appearing in this underrated thriller are Connie Nielson, Eriq La Salle and Gary Cole.  Mark Romanek directed Robin Williams in this spooky but excellent film.

questions.text: In the 2002 dark comedy 'Death to Smoochy', Robin Williams plays the character Smoochy the Rhino.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Robin Williams plays 'Rainbow' Randolph Smiley, a rival children's television host who seeks the death of Smoochy, played by Ed Norton.  Danny DeVito directs and co-stars in this cynical look at television for kids, poking fun at the 'Barneys' of the world. I hope you have enjoyed this quiz, thank you for playing!
